H0.text: who is the present rajya sabha speaker of india. Arun Jaitley

H1.text: who is the present rajya sabha speaker of india. Sushma Swaraj

H2.text: who is the present rajya sabha speaker of india. Nitin Gadkari

H3.text: who is the present rajya sabha speaker of india. Venkaiah Naidu

A4.text: He took the oath as the vice president of India and the chairman of the Rajya Sabha (ex-officio as the Vice President) on 11 August 2017.

A5.text: As of October 2025, the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha is C. P. Radhakrishnan, who is also the Vice President of India.

A7.text: The vice president receives a salary in the capacity of the ex officio chairman of the Rajya Sabha, which is currently ₹400,000 (US$4,700) per month (revised from ₹125,000 in 2018).

A8.text: The vice president is entitled to free furnished residence, medical, travel, and other facilities.

A9.text: The vice president is the only official who does not get any salary and emoluments of his designated post (i.e. vice president).

A10.text: The pension for the vice president is 50% of the salary.

A11.text: The Vice‑President of India is the ex‑officio chairperson of the Rajya Sabha.
